summary: This bill, the COMPLETE Care Act, aims to improve behavioral health integration within primary care under Medicare. It provides financial incentives (increased payment amounts) to healthcare providers for specific behavioral health integration services (identified by HCPCS codes) furnished in 2027, 2028, and 2029.  It also mandates the Secretary of Health and Human Services to offer technical assistance to primary care practices to help them adopt behavioral health integration models.  Funding is appropriated for this technical assistance program through 2029.
